Name: Unbreakable
Description: The item does not take damage.

Name: Guardian
Description: The attuned may use their reaction to redirct an attack made against an adjacent creature to themselves.

Name: Sensational magic
Description: When a creature first touches the object, they feel a predetermined sensation

Name: Unlikely save
Description: The attuned recieves +1 to their saving throws

Name: Skillful edge
Description: The attuned recieves +1 to a specific ability check when performing a specific action

Name: Gleaming
Description: The item is always clean

Name: Known weaknesses
Description: The attuned recieves +1 to a specific ability check when competing against a specific race or creature type

Name: A glimmer of magic
Description: The weilder can use the magic item to cast one of two predetermined cantrips

Name: Moonlit
Description: The item casts dim light for a 10' radius when in darkness

Name: Light warning
Description: The item cast dim light for a 10' radius when a creature of a specific creature type or race is within 120'

Name: Mark of the apprentice
Description: The Item can be used to cast a predetermined level one spell once per day. The level of the spell can be increased when conjoining the effects of other similar properties

Name: Mark of the defender
Description: The item grants immunity to a specific level 1 spell or cantrip while worn. This spell cannot be cast again until after a long rest

Name: On/Off command
Description: The weilder can use a bonus action to speak a command to activate or deactivate a predetermined and persitiant property of this item

Name: Easily lost
Description: The item is invisible while worn or sheathed

Name: Arcane focus
Description: The item can be used as an arcane focus

Name: Valuable
Description: The item appears twice as valuable

Name: Rubbish
Description: The item appears to be worthless

Name: Tattoo
Description: The item is tattooed onto the caster

Name: Mark of the learned
Description: The item can be used to cast a predetermined level 2 spell. The level of the spell can be increased when conjoining the effects of other similar properties. This spell cannot be cast again until after a long rest

Name: Flying objects
Description: The item gains a flying speed of 50. It will hover inplace if left and can be towed. It has a maximum carrying capacity of 400lbs but it's flying speed becomes 30' if it is carrying over 200 lbs.

Name: Give it wings
Description: While wearing the item, the attuned gains a flying speed equal to their walking speed. They can use the item to fly for up to four hours, all at once or in several shorter flights, each one using a minimium of 1 minute from the duration. If you are flying when the duration expires, you descend at a rate of 30 feet per round until you land. The Item regains 2 hours of dlying capability for every 12 hours they aren't in use.

Name: Deep rest
Description: The attuned regains an additional level of exhaustion after a long rest

Name: Comfortable armour
Description: The armour is very comfortable. The wearer can rest in it without any of the normal detrimental effects

Name: Darkvision
Description: The wearer gains Darkvision for 60'. If they already have Darkvision, wearing this item will extend it an additional 60'

Name: Telescopic vision
Description: The wearer can see things up to 120' away as if they were directly infront of them so long as they have a direct line of sight

Name: Telescopic smell
Description: The wearer can use the magic item to smell an area up to 120' away as if they were within it.

Name: Minor benefit Attack bonus
Description: Gain a +1 to your attack and damage rolls while using this item

Name: Minor benefit AC bonus
Description: Gain +1 AC while wearing this item

Name: Minor benefit Spell bonus
Description: Gain +1 to your Spell attack and Spell Save DCs while using this item as an arcane focus

Name: Skillful
Description: The attuned gains +5 to a specific check when performing a specific action

Name: Advantage seeker
Description: The attuned gains advantage to a specific check when performing a specific action

Name: Fast worker
Description: The attuned performs an additional work week's worth of work per week worked while crafting magical items

Name: Necrotic touch
Description: On a successful attack while using this item as a weapon, the victim cannot regain health until the start of your next turn

Name: Prismatic
Description: The attuned may use a bonus action to switch a persitant property of this item to another predetermined one of the same property type

Name: The spice of life
Description: The item is capable of casting an additional predetermined spell of the same level as any it is already capable of casting

Name: Taking control
Description: The attuned casts the spells from the item instead of taking the use item action

Name: Mark of the steady
Description: The item can be used to cast a predetermined level 1 spell. The level of the spell can be increased when conjoining the effects of other similar properties. This spell can be cast up to 3 times between long rests

Name: Damage dealer
Description: This item deals an additional 1d6 damage of a predetermined type on a successfull attack while being used as a weapon

Name: Gift of health
Description: Spells restore an additional 1d4 health when this item is used as the arcane focus to cast them

Name: Bigger on the inside
Description: The item contains 64' of cubic space. An opening must be present in order to access this space. It cannot hold more than 500 lbs. This adds 15 lbs to the weight of the item regardless of it's contents. If the item is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed. and it's contents are scattered to the astral plane. Placing this item inside an extradimensional space instantly destroys both item sand opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10' of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the astral plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened

Name: Resistance
Description: The attuned grants resistance to a predetermined damage type while wearing this item

Name: Cantrips galore
Description: The weilder can use this item to cast one of six predetermined cantrips

Name: Adamantine
Description: The wearer cannot be crit against

Name: Slayer
Description: Gain +3 to your attack and damage rolls when using this item as a weapon against a predetermined creature type

Name: Mark of the Maji
Description: The item can be used to cast predetermined spells whose combined number of levels equals seven. The level of the spells can be increased when conjoining the effects of other similar properties. This spell cannot be cast again until after a long rest

Name: Mark of the steadfast
Description: The item can be used to cast predetermined spells whose combined number of levels equals four. The level of the spells can be increased when conjoining the effects of other similar properties. The spells in this list can be cast a combined times of three between long rests

Name: Mark of the cantrip master
Description: The weilder can use the magic item to cast one of 21 predetermined cantrips

Name: Symbol of great Strength
Description: The attuned gains +2 to Strength while touching this item. Their maxumum is increased to 22

Name: Symbol of great Constitution
Description: The attuned gains +2 to Constitution while touching this item. Their maxumum is increased to 22

Name: Symbol of great Dexterity
Description: The attuned gains +2 to Dexterity while touching this item. Their maxumum is increased to 22

Name: Symbol of great Wisdom
Description: The attuned gains +2 to Wisdom while touching this item. Their maxumum is increased to 22

Name: Symbol of great Intelligence
Description: The attuned gains +2 to Intelligence while touching this item. Their maxumum is increased to 22

Name: Symbol of great Charisma
Description: The attuned gains +2 to Charisma while touching this item. Their maxumum is increased to 22

Name: Emblem of aggresion
Description: Gain a +3 to your attack and damage rolls while using this item as a weapon

Name: Emblem of protection
Description: Gain +3 AC while wearing this item

Name: Emblem of spellcraft
Description: Gain +3 to your Spell attack and Spell Save DCs while using this item as an arcane focus

Name: Damage wholesaler
Description: This item deals an additional 4d6 damage of a predetermined type on a successfull attack while being used as a weapon

Name: blessing of health
Description: Spells restore an additional 4d4 health when this item is used as the arcane focus to cast them

Name: Mark of the infinite
Description: The item can be used to cast predetermined spells whose combined number of levels equals 2. The level of the spells can be increased when conjoining the effects of other similar properties. The spells in this list can be cast an infinite amount of times

Name: Damage invulnerability
Description: The creature attuned to this item is immune to a predetermined damage type while touching the item

Name: Armour piercing
Description: Damage from this item of s apsecific type ignores resistance

Name: Devastaing
Description: When using this item as a weapon, you can reroll ones rolled on your damage dice. This ability can only be used once per attack

Name: Tireless
Description: The creature attuned to this item is immune cannot gain exhaustion while touching it, and any effects due to exhaustion are suspended.

Name: Magic weakness
Description: While attuned to the artifact, you have disadvantage on saving throws against spells.

Name: Sidam's touch
Description: The first time you touch a gem or piece of jewelry while attuned to this artifact, the value of the gem or jewelry is reduced by half.

Name: Bound sight
Description: While attuned to the artifact, you are blinded when you are more than 10 feet away from it.

Name: Poison weakness
Description: While attuned to the artifact, you have disadvantage on saving throws against poison.

Name: Sacrifice of pleasant company
Description: While attuned to the artifact, you emit a sour stench noticeable from up to 10 feet away.

Name: Desanctifying aura
Description: While attuned to the artifact, all holy water within 10 feet of you is destroyed.

Name: Sacrifice of health
Description: While attuned to the artifact, you are physically ill and have disadvantage on any ability check or saving throw that uses Strength or Constitution.

Name: Girth mark
Description: While attuned to the artifact, your weight increases by 1d4 × 10 pounds.

Name: Sacrifice of form
Description: While attuned to the artifact, your appearance changes as the DM decides.

Name: Sacrifice of hearing
Description: While attuned to the artifact, you are deafened when you are more than 10 feet away from it.

Name: Gaunt mark
Description: While attuned to the artifact, your weight drops by 1d4 × 5 pounds.

Name: Sacrifice of smell
Description: While attuned to the artifact, you can’t smell.

Name: Fire's flight
Description: While attuned to the artifact, nonmagical flames are extinguished within 30 feet of you.

Name: Sacrifice of rest
Description: While you are attuned to the artifact, other creatures can’t take short or long rests while within 300 feet of you.

Name: Wilting touch
Description: While attuned to the artifact, you deal 1d6 necrotic damage to any plant you touch that isn’t a creature.

Name: Unatural aura
Description: While you are attuned to the artifact, animals within 30 feet of you are hostile toward you.

Name: Sacrifice of satiation
Description: While attuned to the artifact, you must eat and drink six times the normal amount each day.

Name: Evident flaws
Description: While you are attuned to the artifact, your flaw is amplified in a way determined by the DM.

Name: Sacrifice of alignment
Description: While you are attuned to the artifact, you determine your alignment daily at dawn by rolling a d6 twice. On the first roll, a 1–2 indicates lawful, 3–4 neutral, and 5–6 chaotic. On the second roll, a 1–2 indicates good, 3–4 neutral, and 5–6 evil.

Name: Sacrifice of purpose
Description: When you first attune to the artifact, it gives you a quest determined by the DM. You must complete this quest as if affected by the geas spell. Once you complete the quest, you are no longer affected by this property.

Name: Mark of possession
Description: The artifact houses a bodiless life force that is hostile toward you. Each time you use an action to use one of the artifact’s properties, there is a 50 percent chance that the life force tries to leave the artifact and enter your body. If you fail a DC 20 Charisma saving throw, it succeeds, and you become an NPC under the DM’s control until the intruding life force is banished using magic such as the dispel evil and good spell.

Name: Sacrifice of life
Description: Creatures with a challenge rating of 0, as well as plants that aren’t creatures, drop to 0 hit points when within 10 feet of the artifact.

Name: Mark of imprisonment
Description: The artifact imprisons a CR 10 creature. Each time you use one of the artifact’s properties as an action, the creature has a 10 percent chance of escaping, whereupon it appears within 15 feet of you and attacks you.

Name: Mark of the reviled
Description: While you are attuned to the artifact, creatures of a particular type other than humanoid (as chosen by the DM) are always hostile toward you.

Name: Aura of dilution
Description: The artifact dilutes magic potions within 10 feet of it, rendering them nonmagical.

Name: Aura of erasure
Description: The artifact erases magic scrolls within 10 feet of it, rendering them nonmagical.

Name: Sacrifice of blood
Description: Before using one of the artifact’s properties as an action, you must use a bonus action to draw blood, either from yourself or from a willing or incapacitated creature within your reach, using a piercing or slashing melee weapon. The subject takes 1d4 damage of the appropriate type.

Name: Sacrifice of sanity
Description: When you become attuned to the artifact, you gain a form of long-term madness (see “Running the Game”).

Name: Mark of mind blast
Description: You take 10d6 psychic damage when you become attuned to the artifact.

Name: Evil is as evil does
Description: Before you can become attuned to the artifact, you must kill a creature of your alignment.

Name: Mark of weakness
Description: When you become attuned to the artifact, one of your ability scores is reduced by 2 at random. A greater restoration spell restores the ability to normal.

Name: Sacrifice of youth
Description: Each time you become attuned to the artifact, you age 3d10 years. You must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or die from the shock. If you die, you are instantly transformed into a wight (see the Monsters Listing) under the DM’s control that is sworn to protect the artifact.

Name: Sacrifice of speech
Description: While attuned to the artifact, you lose the ability to speak.

Name: Mark of vulnerability
Description: While attuned to the artifact, you have vulnerability to all damage.

Name: Mark of divine intrest
Description: When you become attuned to the artifact, there is a 10 percent chance that you attract the attention of a god that sends an avatar to wrest the artifact from you. The avatar has the same alignment as its creator and the statistics of an empyrean (see the Monsters Listing). Once it obtains the artifact, the avatar vanishes.
